meta.job_title: Director of Scientific and Clinical Initiatives

duties_responsibilities.duty: Serve as a liaison on scientific topics between staff, Board of Directors, Science Committee, and Professional Advisory Board (PAB)
Communicate with pharmaceutical and biotech companies regarding clinical trial progression and outcomes
Advise and offer feedback on grant submissions for the funding of Dup15q-related research
Act as the Dup15q Alliance representative to other institutions including the NIH, FDA, pharma, biotech, etc.
Understand the current literature pertaining to the symptoms, clinical trials, molecular mechanisms of the disorder, and therapeutic developments
Coordinate with the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of the clinical research network (the LADDER Learning Network – LLN)
Present important scientific and research opportunities to the Board of Directors
Interact with other non-profit rare disease advocacy groups to identify areas of synergy and opportunities to work collaboratively
Engage with the Science Committee to stay up to date on current science and research initiatives sponsored by and for the Alliance
Develop and produce scientific and medical content for Alliance educational programs and updates to the community
Support clinicians and scientists studying Dup15q through administrative work, grant or manuscript writing, and coordination of key personnel
Attend relevant conferences to stay up-to-date on ground-breaking research related to Dup15q and related neurodevelopmental/seizure disorders

education_certification.credential: Ph.D. in a science or medical field and/or MD
